Description: I purchased thIs Epiphone Sheraton II in early 2004. I was in New York City and in need of a guitar… all of mine were about 425 miles away in Ohio. I went to Manny’s Music on West 48th and, after shopping awhile, I settled on this Epiphone. It plays as good today as it did that day. Very nice action… nice neck… holds tuning very well. It has a beautiful natural finish with beautiful grain and gold plated hardware. Being a John Lennon fan, I removed the pickguard and bought a John Lennon Epiphone case for it… the case set me back another $189.00. The case itself is probably a collector’s item today. Anyway, I have reinstalled the pickguard. This guitar is about as close to mint as it can be for 15 years old. Other than the NYC jams and some gentle playing around my studio, it’s never been out of the house. There is a small nick in on the case that’s difficult to see because of the color… it’s to the left of Lennon’s signature. The gold pickups could use a bit of tarnish cleaner. Other than that, it’s all near mint. I’ve included a photo of my original Manny’s bill of sale. It contains my address and credit card info, so I’ve covered that with a business card. Because of all the personal info on it, I won’t include the bill of sale. I can make a color photocopy if you’d like, with my info covered. I will only ship to the 48 contiguous U.S. states. No international bidders please. Thanks for looking.
Title: 2003 Epiphone Sheraton II Natural Finish with John Lennon Case
